d:doc.name: Logan.URL
d:doc.shortDescription:
The URL object represents a URL.
It allows you parse, construct and manipulate the seperate parts of the URL easily
d:doc.longDescription:
You can pass to the constructor a URL as a string which will parsed automatically
At that point you can access the individual Properties of the object to read or manipulate the URL

argument.name: propertyMap
argument.description: The initial set of Properties to set

constructor.example:
var u = new Logan.URL({ "protocol" : "http", "host" : "google.com" });
u.toString(); // http://google.com

constructor.description: Creates a new URL object with the given url

argument.name: propertyMap
argument.description: The initial set of Properties to set

constructor.example:
var u = new Logan.URL("http://google.com", { "path" : "/hello/index.html" });
u.toString(); // http://google.com/hello/index.html

property.name: host
property.description: The host address of the URL

property.name: port
property.description: The port number of the URL

property.name: query
property.description: The query parameters of the URL

method.name: getQueryParameter
method.description: Returns the value of a query parameter

returns.description:
The value of the query parameter requested.
null if no such query key exists

argument.name: key
argument.description: The key of the query parameter to get

method.name: setQueryParameter

argument.name: key
argument.description: The key of the query parameter to set

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value you want to set the query key to

argument.name: key
argument.description: The key of the query parameter to unset

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns the full URL as a string

returns.description: The full URL as a string.
